adr_address: 2 Pl. des Pyramides, 75001 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Refined hotel offering genteel quarters, plus dining, an English bar/lounge & a courtyard garden.

name: Hotel Regina Louvre

reviews.text:
Our stay at the Regina Hotel Louvre was absolutely wonderful and incredibly relaxing. The service was impeccable from the moment we arrived. We were celebrating our anniversary, and the staff went above and beyond to make it special. To our delight, beautiful flowers and champagne were waiting for us in our room – a very thoughtful and much-appreciated touch.
The hotel itself is stunning. We particularly enjoyed the beautiful and quiet inner courtyard garden, which was a perfect oasis for a peaceful moment. The breakfast was delicious, offering a great start to our day, and the hotel's cuisine was excellent overall.
The location is simply top-notch, with everything we wanted to see right on our doorstep.
We had a truly memorable anniversary and will definitely be coming back. Highly recommended!

This is a fantastic Hotel!  The staff and management went above and beyond to see we had anything and everything we needed. They were professional, kind and very knowledgeable. You could not get a much better location, right in the middle of everything. The rooms were beautiful, clean and larger than expected. I travel a lot and was very impressed with the hotel and would recommend it to all.

Stayed 5 nights, beautiful Hotel and the staff are fabulous. The restaurant for dinner was lovely and a good menu. Breakfast room is lovely and lots of variety to choose from.
After a long day it was nice to come back to the Hotel and relax in their bar area for a quiet drink.
Highly recommend, stunning views of Eiffel Tower and opposite Lourve, location perfect.

I recently had the opportunity to spend a weekend in Paris and chose to stay at the Hôtel Regina Louvre. Prior to my stay, I carefully reviewed the hotel’s history and guest experiences, and even watched an interview with the owner, whose family also manages another renowned property in Paris. The building is undeniably a historical monument located in the very heart of the city, and its architectural beauty and prime location are truly remarkable.

The reception staff demonstrated a high level of professionalism, and the overall service at the front desk met five-star expectations. However, I feel it is important to share certain aspects of my stay that did not align with the standard one would anticipate from a hotel of this category.

Unfortunately, the hotel is in urgent need of renovation. The carpets throughout the property, including in the guest rooms, are heavily worn and emit a strong musty and stale odor, which significantly affected my comfort. In my room, I found it unpleasant to walk on the carpet, and the general atmosphere felt unclean and outdated.

Housekeeping services were insufficient. While towels were replaced and the bed was made, the room was not thoroughly cleaned. Dust was present on multiple surfaces, and the bathtub showed visible signs of mold. Additionally, the room lacked a proper coffee machine, which is a basic amenity expected in a five-star accommodation.

While I fully appreciate the historical value of the building, there is a clear distinction between preserving heritage and neglecting necessary maintenance. The current condition of the interiors does not reflect the quality and comfort associated with luxury hospitality.

I hope this feedback will be taken into consideration for future improvements. With thoughtful renovation and attention to detail, the Hôtel Regina Louvre has the potential to truly live up to its five-star status.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Regina in Paris a few days ago. This boutique hotel met all expectations and beyond. Top quality service from the door man, to reception, to bar/restaurant, to room service- ALL experiences were (5) star and “super stars” of customer service.

The hotel location was in a very central location adjacent to the Louve - (5) minute walk. Our room was an Eiffel Tower view suite very spacious and well appointed (and yes- the Tower was in absolute clear view).

I suggest you add this Hotel to your Buck-list when in Paris.  Don’t  get me wrong, top quality service comes with a price and it was worth every dollar spent.

Hats off to your entire team. We will absolutely return without question.
